attributes.action: dissolve parliament, and for MPs embroiled in the expenses scandal to resign and not stand for re-election.
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background: In the light of the recent revelations regarding expenses there has been an obvious breakdown in trust between the general public and Westminster. In order to restore faith a necessary and difficult renewal must occur. Any MP who has made ‘excessive’ claims within the current expense system must stand down. The hollow words, “it was within the rules, I’ve done nothing wrong” cannot be used as protection against such a flagrant abuse of the taxpayer. Parliament has a duty to act with the highest moral values, to represent the will of the people, and to treat with respect the position to which they have been elected. Those that have so clearly failed to act with honesty and integrity must accept the consequences of their actions. Our democratic institutions must be renewed.

reasons: Duplicate - this is similar to and/or overlaps with an existing petition or petitions
